newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: FORMER GRUNDIG CHIEF APPOINTED PHILIPS ASIA EXEC.
newsitem.headline: FORMER GRUNDIG CHIEF APPOINTED PHILIPS ASIA EXEC.

text.p: Philips Electronics NV said on Wednesday Pieter van der Wal, the former chief executive of Grundig, has been appointed Philips' regional executive Asia Pacific effective May 1.

Philips said country managers in the region will report to Van der Wal under a new management format in which regional executives supervise country organisations and identify new business opportunities.
Van der Wal, who joined Philips in 1958, stepped down from Grundig in February, having been at the head of the loss-making German consumer electronics company since February 1996.
Philips owns 32 percent of Grundig and earlier this year said it had given up control of the company to take the role of a passive minority shareholder.
The Dutch company aims to dissolve its pact with the Max Grundig Foundation under which it pays an annual dividend to the Grundig family heirs of some 45 million marks until 2004.
Under the arrangement with Grundig, Philips had majority control over the German company, despite its minority holding.
